definition: to fade/(fig.) to lose luster/(of an event etc) to be spoiled/(coinage) to become debased
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: It's loose plot spoils the novel.
sentences.chinese: 情节松散使这篇小说大为减色。

sentences.english: Traditional mottos are also strong enough to survive ridicule.
sentences.chinese: 传统训诫则强劲有力，即便遭到挖苦也毫不减色。

sentences.english: The novel is blemished by those long descriptions.
sentences.chinese: 那些冗长的描写使小说大为减色。

sentences.english: A colorless reducer (magnesia in linseed oil) used to extend lithographic inks and lessen their color strength.
sentences.chinese: 中义减色剂，使平版油墨容易延展并降低色强度。

sentences.english: The classic loses much in translation.
sentences.chinese: 这部经典作品经翻译后减色不少。

sentences.english: Its loose plot spoils the novel.
sentences.chinese: 情节松散使这篇小说大为减色。

sentences.english: Her paleness took from her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 脸上的苍白使她花容减色。

definition: surprised and admiring/to appreciate with surprise
shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
rendering (computing)/to add washes of ink or color to a drawing (Chinese painting)/to exaggerate/to embellish
relief shading (in a picture)/fig. to throw into relief
... hence the name (used at the end of a sentence)
